result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin L. Palmer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kevin L. Palmer is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kevin L. Palmer was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property-Special Facts, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Obtain and maintain full time employment.
Submit to AODA assessment within 30 days and comply with any recommendations.

records.addlTxt: Order from Judge Knox-Bauer granting sentence credit request
To Judge Knox*Bauer from DOC dated 09/12/19 re: request for Court review of sentence credit.

10:44 AM Court calls cases 16CF26 and 16CF76 and states appearances. Defendant Kevin L. Palmer appeared by video means with Attorney William Allen Dickens Jr.  Defendant in custody in Dodge Correctional Institution.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties acknowledge receipt of revocation packet and waive reading. Comments by Atty Dickens. DA certifies Victim Rights Compliance. DA state Victim would like to read statement to the court on case 16CF26. Comments and recommendations by DA. Comments and by Atty Dickens. Victim gives comments to the court. Comments by DE. Summation by Court. Court imposes on Revocation Cases. 

Court imposes:

16CF26
Ct. 2
5 years in WI prison consisting of 2 years initial confinement and followed by 3 year extended supervision. Prison sentence is concurrent to 16CF76 and also concurrent to sentence in Rusk County case 17CF126. 
DE is given 65 days sentence credit.
DE is eligible for Substance abuse program
Reimpose all prior monetary obligation with credit for payments made.
Conditions of extended supervision DE to comply with AODA and follow through with any recommendations. DE must comply with any counseling, submit to DNA and pay surcharge. DE to maintain full time employment


16CF76
Ct. 1
6 years in WI prison consisting of 3 years initial confinement and followed by 3 year extended supervision. Prison sentence is concurrent to 16CF26 and also concurrent to sentence in Rusk County case 17CF126. 
DE is given 333 days sentence credit.
DE is eligible for Substance abuse program
Reimpose all prior monetary obligation with credit for payments made.
Conditions of extended supervision DE to comply with AODA and follow through with any recommendations. DE must comply with any counseling, submit to DNA and pay surcharge. DE to maintain full time employment


DE is eligible for ERP and Not eligible Challenge incarceration program

Appeal Rights Given and will be returned to the court by Atty Dickens
Correspondence from judge Knox Bauer approving DE to appear by video
DE request to appear by video for sentencing on rev
Notice of hearing
Sentencing hearing on revocation on July 18, 2019 at 10:30 am.

09:30 AM Court calls cases 16CF26 and 16CF76 Defendant Kevin L. Palmer appeared, in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court states victim would like to be present and DE did not recieve Revocation packet. DA just gave DE copy of the revocation packet. Court questions DE on sentencing on revocation to be rescheduled for 2:30pm Next Thursday. DE states that date is fine and wants an attorney present and sentening. Court questions DA on status of time frame of DE getting a public defender. DA gives comments.   Notice of right to attorney given to DE. Adj at 9:34 am
Days credit worksheet
Notice of hearing
Sentencing hearing on revocation on May 23, 2019 at 09:15 am.

1:57 pm - DA calls cases 16CF26, 16CF76 and 16CF78 and states appearances and agreement reached.  Defendant Kevin L. Palmer in court with attorney Kevin G. Klein.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties acknowledge receipt of PSI report.  DA certifies victims rights compliance.  DA has given Court a victim impact statement.  Argument by DA. Comments by Atty Klein.  Comments by DE.  Summation by Court.  DE to submit DNA sample at PRSO.  Court imposes:

16CF26 - Sentence withheld, 3 years probation
Conditions of probation
$300 fine
$250 DNAAS
Submit to AODA assessment within 30 days and comply with any recommendations.
Obtain and maintain full time employment.

16CF76 - Sentence withheld, 3 years probation
Conditions of probation
$300 fine
$250 DNAAS
Submit to AODA assessment within 30 days and comply with any recommendations.
9 months jail with huber with credit for time served of 220 days.
Obtain and maintain full time employment.
Contraband to be destroyed after appeal time has expired

16CF78 - Sentence withheld, 3 years probation
Conditions of probation
$300 fine

Submit to AODA assessment within 30 days and comply with any recommendations.
Obtain and maintain full time employment.

Sentencing hearing on May 16, 2017 at 01:45 pm.
of Preliminary Examination
see minutes under plea and sentencing this date

11:08 am - DA calls cases 16CF26, 16CF76, 16CF77 and 16CF78 and states appearances and states agreement. Defendant Kevin L. Palmer in court with attorney Kevin G. Klein.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Klein presents court with waiver of preliminary form.  Court questions DE regarding waiver.  Court accepts waiver.  Informations filed, acknowledged by parties and reading waived.  DE enters plea of NO CONTEST to all Ct 2 in 16CF26, Ct 1 in16CF76 and Ct 1 in16CF78.  Court questions DE regarding the plea.  DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC on those counts, and on motion of DA, dismisses Ct 1 in 16CF26, both counts in 16CF77 and Cts 2 &3 in 16CF78.  Court advised DE of loss of rights to vote and own firearms.  Court would like a pre-sentence investigation.  Argument by Klein.  Court orders pre-sentence.
Preliminary hearing on March 20, 2017 at 11:00 am.

10:32 am - DA calls cases 16CF26, 16CF76, 16CF77, and 16CF78 and states appearances and various bonds that are imposed at this time..  Defendant Kevin L. Palmer in court with attorney Kevin G. Klein.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Comments by Atty Klein.  DA states DE recent charges and offenses and recommends continued cash bond.  Argument by Atty Klein.  Comments and ruling by court.  Court finds bonds to be appropriate and declines to modify.
Preliminary hearing on December 12, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Kevin L. Palmer appeared with attorney Kevin G. Klein.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.  Preliminary hearing requested, time limits waived.  Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.  Bond to continue.
State's Demand for Discovery & Notice of Intent to Use DNA Evidence

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release. Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.  Defendant may not have contact with Stevee Morgan or go upon her residence at W6669 Hemlock Lane, Phillips, WI or any residence occupied by her in the future.

10:29 am - Plaintiff, District Attorney Mark T. Fuhr, by telephone. Defendant, in person, in custody. DA calls case and states appearances and possible charges.  DE next court date is 06-21-16 at 10 am.  Court gives DE a notice of right to attorney and victim witness intimidation form.  Court questions parties as to bond.  DA states bond recommendation.  Court grants DA 5 business days in which to file complaint.
